@Destroyer of shitty hentai I agree, I think he's assuming somethings about her that he's got wrong, but overtime if the relationship goes well, that's bound to come out. She was comfortable confiding some of her past in him, I'm sure she'd reveal more as time goes on. Or she won't. If she wants to keep her past in the past, that's fine. Her enjoying consensual swapping orgy sex is fine, it's her sex life and I don't think Kido should tell her what to do, he's not her boyfriend, so that's crossing a line. She even says it has nothing to do with him, and she's right (IMO). That's what I meant by purity, my mistake for not being clear. On the brothers...I just don't know what I think about them in relation to Kido, as they interact with Kido so little. Like, you could say they were wrong to hit on the girls, but the younger one asked immediately if they were dating Kido, they said no, so it's really fair game. Honestly, I'm just not sure if they were bullying Kido or not.

@pyrexo1 While I can poke a lot of holes in that moral and logic, but let get the fact that both of us can agree is that the new guy can accept her is that because of his wrong assuming of her and not the real her, also what about all of this "purity" on Kido? The problem is that she has sex with his siblings who bully him, sure he want her to change back into the way she was before, but let me remind you that the current her is the person who enjoys not just has sex while being student but a person who enjoy swapping orgy, it is not THAT strange for him to said that to her

@Destroyer of shitty hentai  You are right that he thought she was a virgin on page 48, but she never said she was, he just assumed so, and that assumption/"misleading" is on him, not on her. I should point out, he didn't assume so in some misogynistic "purity" way - he assumed that she had no experience and that he would have to take the lead. Also...why would you expect her to *say* whether or not she's a virgin? Do you expect every girl you have sex to to say that? No of course not, that's none of your business. Finally, he is not a "lucky" Kido, Kido's issue was he couldn't move on from one girl and felt the need to tell her how to behave. This guy accepted being turned down (page 33) and is comfortable with her being a lewd girl. The doujin is teaches two things 1. Accept & move on if someone doesn't like you romantically 2. Accept that some women are lewd and that's fine. Kido couldn't do either so he failed, the new guy does both and gets a happy ending. "Luck" wasn't involved.

As usual, the real problems in NTR are the women.

The Previous MC was greatly insecure, he was always compared to both his older brother and younger brother. He was the failure, the missing link so it was hard for him to find solace at home. When the events in the previous chapters happened he was shaken and had nobody to turn to. He was alone and isolated. His brothers who should have been there for him were the cause of his problems and he had no friend. 
The new MC doesn't seem to have that kind of background so he could easily say that the previous MC was a Wuss but i d'ont think he could have better had they switched place. It's like raiding a multiplayer boss game alone and without preparation: you are doomed to fail.
Personnaly, i hope the author will write a sequel about the previous MC finding happiness because with the brothers he had he doesn't need enemies.
